Get all scheduled posts for the authenticated user.

**Query Parameters**:
- **platform**: Optional - Filter by platform (instagram, linkedin, twitter, tiktok)
- **status**: Optional - Filter by status (scheduled, published, failed, cancelled, publishing)
- **limit**: Optional - Maximum number of posts to return (1-100)
- **offset**: Optional - Offset for pagination

**Returns**:
List of scheduled posts with details including:
- scheduled_post_id: ID of the scheduled post
- platform: Platform name (instagram, linkedin, etc.)
- post_type: Type of post (image, video, text, etc.)
- post_data: Post data (caption, media_id, etc.)
- scheduled_time: When the post is scheduled to be published
- status: Current status (scheduled, published, failed, etc.)
- time_until_scheduled: Human-readable time until scheduled time
- published_post_id: ID of published post (if published)
- published_post_url: URL of published post (if published)
- error_message: Error message (if failed)
- created_at, updated_at, published_at: Timestamps

**Example Request**:
```bash
# Get all scheduled posts
GET /scheduled-posts/my-scheduled-posts

# Get only Instagram scheduled posts
GET /scheduled-posts/my-scheduled-posts?platform=instagram

# Get only scheduled (not yet published) posts
GET /scheduled-posts/my-scheduled-posts?status=scheduled

# Get Instagram posts that are scheduled (paginated)
GET /scheduled-posts/my-scheduled-posts?platform=instagram&status=scheduled&limit=20&offset=0
```

patch.description:
Update a scheduled post (partial update supported).

**Important**: When updating scheduled_time, the system will:
- Cancel the existing Celery task in Redis
- Create a new Celery task with the updated time
- This ensures the post publishes at the NEW time, not the old one

**Path Parameters**:
- **scheduled_post_id**: UUID of the scheduled post to update

**Request Body** (all fields optional - only include fields you want to update):
- **scheduled_time**: Optional - New scheduled time (ISO format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)
  - If provided, will cancel old task and create new one
  - Must be in the future if post is scheduled
- **post_data**: Optional - Post data to update (will merge with existing data)
  - For Instagram: Can update `caption`, `location_id`, `container_id`, `thumbnail_timestamp`, etc.
  - Example: `{"caption": "New caption text"}`
- **status**: Optional - New status (e.g., "cancelled" to cancel the post)
  - Valid statuses: `scheduled`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `publishing`, `published`
  - Setting to `"cancelled"` will cancel the Celery task in Redis
  - All posts can be updated regardless of status

**Note**: 
- When updating `scheduled_time`, the system will automatically:
  - Cancel the old Celery task in Redis
  - Create a new Celery task with the updated time
  - This ensures the post publishes at the NEW time
- If updating `scheduled_time` for a scheduled post, it must be in the future

**Example Request**:
```json
{
    "scheduled_time": "2025-11-05T15:30:00",
    "post_data": {
        "caption": "Updated caption text"
    }
}
```

**Example - Cancel a post**:
```json
{
    "status": "cancelled"
}
```

schema.description: Fields to update (all optional - partial update supported)

post.description:
Single upload endpoint for:
- Single image
- Single video  
- Multiple images (carousel)

All media is uploaded to storage.postsiva.com and URL is stored in database.

**For Single Image/Video:**
- Provide either `media` (file) OR `media_url` (URL)
- Set `media_type` to "image" or "video"
- Optional: Set `platform` to organize by platform (e.g., "instagram", "linkedin")

**For Multiple Images (Carousel):**
- Provide `images` (files) OR `image_urls` (comma-separated URLs) OR both
- Set `media_type` to "images"
- Minimum 2 images, maximum 35 images
- Optional: Set `platform` to organize by platform

**Example - Upload Single Image:**
```bash
curl -X POST "/media/upload"       -H "Authorization: Bearer TOKEN"       -F "media=@photo.jpg"       -F "media_type=image"
```

**Example - Upload Single Video:**
```bash
curl -X POST "/media/upload"       -H "Authorization: Bearer TOKEN"       -F "media=@video.mp4"       -F "media_type=video"
```

**Example - Upload Multiple Images:**
```bash
curl -X POST "/media/upload"       -H "Authorization: Bearer TOKEN"       -F "images=@photo1.jpg"       -F "images=@photo2.jpg"       -F "media_type=images"
```

**Returns:**
- `media_id`: Use this when creating posts on any platform
- `public_url`: URL from storage.postsiva.com

post.description:
Post to multiple platforms simultaneously using unified media.

**Single API call to post to Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, TikTok!**

## Request Body Parameters

### Common Parameters
- **`media_id`** (string, optional): Single media ID from unified_media table. Required for platforms that need media (Instagram always, TikTok always). Optional for text-only posts on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn.
- **`media_ids`** (array of strings, optional): Multiple media IDs for carousel posts. Use this instead of `media_id` for carousel posts.
- **`platforms`** (array of strings, required): List of platforms to post to. Valid values: `["instagram", "twitter", "linkedin", "facebook", "tiktok"]`
- **`text`** (string, optional): Universal text field that gets mapped to caption/title/text per platform. Can be overridden by platform-specific params.
- **`post_type`** (string, optional): Global post type. Valid values: `"post"`, `"story"`, `"reel"`, `"draft"`, `"carousel"`. Default: `"post"`
- **`scheduled_time`** (string, optional): ISO format datetime string (e.g., `"2025-01-20T10:00:00"`) for scheduling posts

### Platform-Specific Parameters

#### Instagram (`instagram_params`)
- **`post_type`** (string, optional): `"post"` | `"story"` | `"reel"` | `"carousel"`. Default: `"post"`
- **`location_id`** (string, optional): Instagram location ID for geotagging
- **`container_id`** (string, optional): Instagram container ID (for video posts)
- **`caption`** (string, optional): Override the global `text` field with Instagram-specific caption
- **`thumbnail_timestamp`** (float, optional): Timestamp in seconds for video story thumbnail. Default: `5.0`
- **`share_to_feed`** (boolean, optional): For reels, whether to share to feed. Default: `true`

#### LinkedIn (`linkedin_params`)
- **`post_type`** (string, optional): `"post"` | `"video"` | `"carousel"`. Default: `"post"`
- **`visibility`** (string, optional): `"PUBLIC"` | `"CONNECTIONS"`. Default: `"PUBLIC"`
- **`text`** (string, optional): Override the global `text` field with LinkedIn-specific text
- **`title`** (string, optional): Video title (for video posts only)
- **`page_id`** (string, optional): LinkedIn page ID (if posting to a page instead of personal profile)

#### Twitter (`twitter_params`)
- **`text`** (string, optional): Override the global `text` field with Twitter-specific tweet text
- **Note**: Twitter supports text-only tweets, single image, multiple images (max 4), and video tweets

#### Facebook (`facebook_params`)
- **`post_type`** (string, optional): `"post"` | `"story"` | `"carousel"`. Default: `"post"`
- **`page_id`** (string, optional): Facebook page ID. **Auto-retrieved from user's managed pages if not provided** - you don't need to specify this!
- **`message`** (string, optional): Override the global `text` field with Facebook-specific message
- **`privacy`** (string, optional): Post privacy setting. Default: `"EVERYONE"`
- **Note**: Facebook supports text-only posts (no `media_id` required). Just provide `text` without `media_id`.

#### TikTok (`tiktok_params`)
- **`post_type`** (string, optional): `"video"` | `"photo"` | `"draft"`. Default: `"video"` for video media, `"photo"` for image media
- **`draft`** (boolean, optional): Alternative to `post_type="draft"` - creates a draft post instead of publishing
- **`title`** (string, optional): Video/photo title (overrides global `text` field)
- **`description`** (string, optional): Video/photo description
- **`privacy_level`** (string, optional): `"PUBLIC_TO_EVERYONE"` | `"SELF_ONLY"` | `"FRIENDS"` | etc. Default: `"PUBLIC_TO_EVERYONE"` for photos, `"SELF_ONLY"` for videos
- **`disable_comment`** (boolean, optional): Disable comments on the post. Default: `false`
- **`auto_add_music`** (boolean, optional): Automatically add music to photos. Default: `false`
- **`brand_content_toggle`** (boolean, optional): Paid partnership content. Default: `false`
- **`brand_organic_toggle`** (boolean, optional): Creator's own business content. Default: `false`
- **`cover_index`** (integer, optional): Index of photo to use as cover for photo posts (0-based). Default: `0`
- **`video_cover_timestamp_ms`** (integer, optional): Timestamp in milliseconds for video cover thumbnail. Default: `1000`
- **`disable_duet`** (boolean, optional): Disable duet feature for videos. Default: `false`
- **`disable_stitch`** (boolean, optional): Disable stitch feature for videos. Default: `false`

## Examples

### Example 1: Post to Instagram and Twitter
```json
{
    "media_id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
    "platforms": ["instagram", "twitter"],
    "text": "Check out this amazing photo! ðŸ“¸",
    "instagram_params": {
        "location_id": "optional-location-id",
        "caption": "Instagram-specific caption"
    },
    "linkedin_params": {
        "visibility": "PUBLIC"
    },
    "facebook_params": {
        "post_type": "post"
    }
}
```

### Example 2: Text-only post to Facebook
```json
{
    "platforms": ["facebook"],
    "text": "Just a text post on Facebook!",
    "facebook_params": {
        "post_type": "post"
    }
}
```

### Example 3: Carousel post to Instagram and Facebook
```json
{
    "media_ids": [
        "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
        "223e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001",
        "323e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174002"
    ],
    "platforms": ["instagram", "facebook"],
    "text": "Check out these amazing photos!",
    "instagram_params": {
        "post_type": "carousel"
    },
    "facebook_params": {
        "post_type": "carousel"
    }
}
```

### Example 4: TikTok video with all parameters
```json
{
    "media_id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
    "platforms": ["tiktok"],
    "text": "Check out my video!",
    "tiktok_params": {
        "post_type": "video",
        "title": "My Awesome Video",
        "description": "This is an amazing video",
        "privacy_level": "PUBLIC_TO_EVERYONE",
        "disable_comment": false,
        "disable_duet": false,
        "disable_stitch": false,
        "video_cover_timestamp_ms": 2000
    }
}
```

## Response

Returns aggregated results from all platforms:
- **`success`**: True if at least one platform succeeded
- **`message`**: Summary message
- **`results`**: Dictionary keyed by platform name with individual results
- **`success_count`**: Number of successful posts
- **`failed_count`**: Number of failed posts
- **`total_count`**: Total number of platforms attempted

Each platform result contains:
- **`platform`**: Platform name
- **`success`**: Whether the post succeeded
- **`message`**: Success or error message
- **`post_id`**: Platform-specific post ID
- **`post_url`**: Direct URL to the post (if available)
- **`data`**: Additional platform-specific data
- **`error`**: Error message (if failed)

## Important Notes

- **Media Upload**: Media must be uploaded first using `/media/upload` endpoint (if posting media)
- **Text-Only Posts**: Some platforms support text-only posts (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn) - just provide `text` without `media_id`
- **Page ID**: Facebook `page_id` is automatically retrieved from user's managed pages - you don't need to provide it!
- **Media Handling**: Each platform's requirements are automatically handled (URL vs file download)
- **Scheduling**: All platforms support scheduling via `scheduled_time` parameter
- **Parallel Processing**: Posts to all platforms are processed in parallel for faster execution

Unified OAuth token creation endpoint for all social media platforms.

This endpoint accepts a platform name and routes the request to the appropriate
platform-specific OAuth handler to initiate the authentication flow.

**Platform Options:**
- `instagram` - Instagram OAuth
- `linkedin` - LinkedIn OAuth
- `linkedin_ads` - LinkedIn Ads OAuth
- `twitter` - Twitter/X OAuth
- `tiktok` - TikTok OAuth
- `facebook` - Facebook OAuth
- `pinterest` - Pinterest OAuth
- `youtube` - YouTube OAuth (Google)
- `google_ads` - Google Ads OAuth

**Example Requests:**
```bash
# Instagram OAuth
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/oauth/instagram/create-token"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"

# LinkedIn OAuth
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/oauth/linkedin/create-token"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"

# Twitter OAuth
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/oauth/twitter/create-token"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```

**Returns:**
- Platform-specific response containing OAuth URL
- User should redirect to the returned URL to complete authentication
- After authentication, OAuth callback will be handled automatically

get.description:
Get all user access tokens for all platforms.

Returns access tokens for all connected platforms. Platforms without tokens will return `null`.
Uses optimized JOIN queries to fetch all tokens efficiently.

**Query Parameters:**
- `platform` (optional): Filter by specific platform name. If provided, returns only that platform's token.
  Supported values: `instagram`, `linkedin`, `linkedin_ads`, `twitter`, `tiktok`, `facebook`, `pinterest`, `youtube`, `google_ads`

**Response Format:**

Without platform filter (all tokens):
```json
{
    "user_id": "user-uuid",
    "tokens": {
        "instagram": {
            "access_token": "token...",
            "refresh_token": "refresh...",
            "token_type": "Bearer",
            "expires_at": "2024-12-31T23:59:59",
            "expires_in": 3600,
            "scope": "user_profile",
            "created_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00",
            "updated_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00"
        },
        "twitter": null,
        "linkedin": {
            "access_token": "token...",
            ...
        },
        ...
    },
    "platforms_with_tokens": ["instagram", "linkedin"],
    "platforms_without_tokens": ["twitter", "tiktok", "facebook", "pinterest", "youtube", "google_ads"]
}
```

With platform filter (single token):
```json
{
    "user_id": "user-uuid",
    "tokens": {
        "instagram": {
            "access_token": "token...",
            ...
        }
    },
    "platforms_with_tokens": ["instagram"],
    "platforms_without_tokens": []
}
```

**Example Requests:**
```bash
# Get all tokens
curl -X GET "http://localhost:8000/oauth/tokens"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"

# Get only Instagram token
curl -X GET "http://localhost:8000/oauth/tokens?platform=instagram"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"

# Get only LinkedIn Ads token
curl -X GET "http://localhost:8000/oauth/tokens?platform=linkedin_ads"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```

delete.description:
Unified OAuth token deletion endpoint for all social media platforms.

This endpoint accepts a platform name and deletes the OAuth token for that platform,
effectively disconnecting the user's account from that social media platform.

**Platform Options:**
- `instagram` - Delete Instagram OAuth token
- `linkedin` - Delete LinkedIn OAuth token
- `linkedin_ads` - Delete LinkedIn Ads OAuth token
- `twitter` - Delete Twitter/X OAuth token
- `tiktok` - Delete TikTok OAuth token
- `facebook` - Delete Facebook OAuth token
- `pinterest` - Delete Pinterest OAuth token
- `youtube` - Delete YouTube OAuth token (Google)
- `google_ads` - Delete Google Ads OAuth token

**Example Requests:**
```bash
# Delete Instagram token
curl -X DELETE "http://localhost:8000/oauth/instagram/delete-token"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"

# Delete LinkedIn token
curl -X DELETE "http://localhost:8000/oauth/linkedin/delete-token"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"

# Delete Twitter token
curl -X DELETE "http://localhost:8000/oauth/twitter/delete-token"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```

**Returns:**
- Success message if token was deleted
- Error message if no token was found or deletion failed

post.description:
Create an image post on LinkedIn using uploaded image media.

**Form Data**:
- **image_id**: Image media ID from `/linkedin/media/image/upload` endpoint (required)
- **text**: Optional caption/text (max 3000 characters)
- **visibility**: Post visibility - "PUBLIC" or "CONNECTIONS" (default: PUBLIC)
- **scheduled_time**: Optional - Schedule post for a future time (ISO format)

**Returns**:
- post_id: LinkedIn post ID
- post_url: Direct link to the post
- image_urn: LinkedIn image asset URN
- posted_at: Timestamp when post was created

**Example**:
```bash
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/linkedin/image-post/"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"       -F "image_id=YOUR_IMAGE_MEDIA_ID"       -F "text=Check out this amazing photo! ðŸ“¸"       -F "visibility=PUBLIC"
```

**LinkedIn Image Upload Process**:
1. Load image from stored media using image_id
2. Register upload with LinkedIn (get upload URL)
3. Upload image binary to LinkedIn's servers
4. Create UGC post with the uploaded image
5. Delete image file from storage after successful post

**Note**: The image file will be deleted after successful posting.

Create a multi-image carousel post on LinkedIn using uploaded image media (2-20 images).

**Form Data**:
- **image_ids**: Comma-separated list of image media IDs from `/linkedin/media/images/upload` endpoint (required)
  - Example: "uuid1,uuid2,uuid3"
  - Minimum 2 images (LinkedIn carousel requirement)
  - Maximum 20 images (LinkedIn's limit)
- **text**: Optional caption/text (max 3000 characters)
- **visibility**: Post visibility - "PUBLIC" or "CONNECTIONS" (default: PUBLIC)
- **scheduled_time**: Optional - Schedule post for a future time (ISO format)

**Returns**:
- post_id: LinkedIn post ID
- post_url: Direct link to the carousel post
- image_count: Number of images in the carousel
- images: Array of uploaded images with URNs
- total_size: Combined size of all images
- posted_at: Timestamp when post was created

**Example**:
```bash
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/linkedin/image-post/multi/"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"       -F "image_ids=uuid1,uuid2,uuid3"       -F "text=Amazing photo collection! ðŸ“¸"       -F "visibility=PUBLIC"
```

**LinkedIn Image Upload Process**:
1. Load all images from stored media using image_ids
2. Validate all images (format, size, count: 2-20)
3. Register each upload with LinkedIn separately
4. Upload all image binaries to LinkedIn's servers
5. Create single carousel UGC post with all images
6. Delete all image files from storage after successful post

**Note**: All image files will be deleted after successful posting.

**Example**:
```bash
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/linkedin/video-post/"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"       -F "video_id=YOUR_VIDEO_MEDIA_ID"       -F "title=My Amazing Video"       -F "text=Check out this amazing video! [VIDEO]"       -F "visibility=PUBLIC"
```

**LinkedIn Video Upload Process**:
1. Load video from stored media using video_id
2. Register upload with LinkedIn (get upload URL)
3. Upload video binary to LinkedIn's servers
4. Create UGC post with the uploaded video
5. Delete video file from storage after successful post
6. LinkedIn processes the video asynchronously (may take a few minutes)

**Note**: Videos may take a few minutes to appear on LinkedIn as they are processed.
The post status will be "processing" initially. The video file will be deleted after successful posting.

post.description:
Fetch and store Google Ads customer account details.

This endpoint:
1. Retrieves the user's Google Ads access token from the database
2. Creates a Google Ads API client
3. Gets all accessible customer IDs using list_accessible_customers()
4. Fetches detailed account information for each customer using get_customer()
5. Stores the account details in the database

**API Logic:**
- If refresh=True: Always fetch fresh data from Google Ads API and update database
- If refresh=False: Return cached data from database if exists, otherwise fetch from Google Ads API and save to database

Args:
    refresh: If True, fetch fresh data from Google Ads API and update database.
            If False, return cached data from database (faster response).

Returns:
- Number of customer accounts found
- Number of accounts successfully stored
- List of customer IDs
- Account details for each customer
- Whether data was refreshed from API

Create a new Search Campaign with all campaign-level parameters.

```json
    "bidding_strategy": "MANUAL_CPC",
    "status": "PAUSED",
    "locations": ["Pakistan", "United States"],

}
```

post.description:
Create multiple positive keywords in an ad group at once.

This endpoint allows you to add multiple keywords to an ad group in a single request,
making the campaign eligible. You can add up to 1000 keywords at once.

**Request Body:**
- ad_group_id: Ad group ID (must match path parameter)
- customer_id: Google Ads customer ID (optional - auto-detected if not provided)
- keywords: Array of keyword objects (1-1000 keywords), each with:
  - text: Keyword text (required, 1-80 characters)
  - match_type: BROAD, PHRASE, or EXACT (optional, default: BROAD)
  - bid: Bid amount in currency units (optional, must be > 0)

**Example Request:**
```json
{
    "ad_group_id": "123456789",
    "customer_id": "3919977443",
    "keywords": [
        {
            "text": "running shoes",
            "match_type": "BROAD",
            "bid": 1.0
        },
        {
            "text": "athletic footwear",
            "match_type": "PHRASE",
            "bid": 1.5
        },
        {
            "text": "sneakers",
            "match_type": "EXACT",
            "bid": 2.0
        }
    ]
}
```

**Simplified Example (without bids):**
```json
{
    "ad_group_id": "123456789",
    "keywords": [
        {"text": "running shoes"},
        {"text": "athletic footwear", "match_type": "PHRASE"},
        {"text": "sneakers", "match_type": "EXACT"}
    ]
}
```

**Response:**
- success: Boolean indicating if the operation succeeded
- message: Success or error message
- keywords_created: Number of keywords successfully created
- ad_group_id: The ad group ID where keywords were added
- customer_id: The customer ID used

**Notes:** 
- Keywords are added as POSITIVE keywords (not negative)
- At least one keyword is required
- Maximum 1000 keywords per request
- Bid amounts are automatically rounded to the nearest billable unit (typically $0.01)
- If you have multiple Google Ads accounts, specify customer_id. Otherwise, it will use your default account.

post.description:
Create a Meta Ads campaign.

**Objective Selection:**
Use the dropdown to select one of the 6 main campaign objectives:
- OUTCOME_LEADS: Generate leads and collect contact information
- OUTCOME_SALES: Drive sales and conversions
- OUTCOME_TRAFFIC: Drive traffic to website/app
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT: Increase page/post engagement
- OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION: Promote app installs
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS: Build brand awareness

The selected objective determines which optimization goals are available when creating ad sets.
The campaign will be created in PAUSED status by default.

Create a Meta Ads campaign with OUTCOME_TRAFFIC objective.

This endpoint automatically sets the objective to OUTCOME_TRAFFIC (drive traffic to website/app).
The optimization goal for ad sets will be automatically set to LINK_CLICKS.

Create a Meta Ads campaign with OUTCOME_LEADS objective.

This endpoint automatically sets the objective to OUTCOME_LEADS (generate leads and collect contact information).
The optimization goal for ad sets will be automatically set to LEAD_GENERATION.

Create a Meta Ads campaign with OUTCOME_SALES objective.

This endpoint automatically sets the objective to OUTCOME_SALES (drive sales and conversions).
The optimization goal for ad sets will be automatically set to CONVERSIONS.

Create a Meta Ads campaign with OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT objective.

This endpoint automatically sets the objective to OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT (increase page/post engagement).
The optimization goal for ad sets will be automatically set to POST_ENGAGEMENT.

Create a Meta Ads campaign with OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION objective.

This endpoint automatically sets the objective to OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION (promote app installs).
The optimization goal for ad sets will be automatically set to APP_INSTALLS.

Create a Meta Ads campaign with OUTCOME_AWARENESS objective.

This endpoint automatically sets the objective to OUTCOME_AWARENESS (build brand awareness).
The optimization goal for ad sets will be automatically set to BRAND_AWARENESS.

post.description:
Create a Meta Ads ad set.

**Campaign Selection:**
campaign_id is REQUIRED. You must create a campaign first using POST /campaigns/create.

**Optimization Goal (Dropdown):**
- The dropdown shows all available optimization goals
- **Recommended:** Leave empty (null) to auto-infer from campaign objective
- **Optional:** Select a specific goal from dropdown (must match campaign objective)
- Invalid selections will be rejected with a clear error message

**Auto-Inference Mapping (when optimization_goal is empty):**
- OUTCOME_LEADS â†’ LEAD_GENERATION
- OUTCOME_SALES â†’ CONVERSIONS
- OUTCOME_TRAFFIC â†’ LINK_CLICKS
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT â†’ POST_ENGAGEMENT
- OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION â†’ APP_INSTALLS
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS â†’ BRAND_AWARENESS

The response will include the optimization_goal that was used (either auto-inferred or user-provided).

**Daily Budget:**
Pass amount in currency units (e.g., 10.0 for $10.00, 300.0 for PKR 300.00).
Backend converts to cents automatically. Minimum varies by currency.

**Tip:** To see valid optimization goals for your campaign, use:
GET /campaigns/{campaign_id}/optimization-goals

Create a Meta Ads ad set for OUTCOME_TRAFFIC campaigns.

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_TRAFFIC campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to LINK_CLICKS

Create a traffic campaign first using POST /campaigns/create/traffic, then use the campaign_id here.

Create a Meta Ads ad set with REACH optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize reach of ads - shows ads to as many people as possible.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to a compatible campaign objective
- optimization_goal is automatically set to REACH

Create a Meta Ads ad set with IMPRESSIONS optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize number of impressions - shows ads to people as many times as possible.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS
- OUTCOME_TRAFFIC
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to a compatible campaign objective
- optimization_goal is automatically set to IMPRESSIONS

Create a Meta Ads ad set with BRAND_AWARENESS optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize ad recall lift - shows ads to people who are likely to remember seeing them.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_AWARENESS campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to BRAND_AWARENESS

Create a Meta Ads ad set with THRUPLAY optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize ThruPlay views - shows video ads to people who will watch the entire video.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to a compatible campaign objective
- optimization_goal is automatically set to THRUPLAY
- billing_event is automatically set to THRUPLAY

Create a Meta Ads ad set with LINK_CLICKS optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize link clicks - shows ads to people likely to click on links.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_TRAFFIC

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_TRAFFIC campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to LINK_CLICKS

post.summary: Create Landing Page Views Ad Set
post.description:
Create a Meta Ads ad set with LANDING_PAGE_VIEWS optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize landing page views - shows ads to people likely to visit your website.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_TRAFFIC

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_TRAFFIC campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to LANDING_PAGE_VIEWS

Create a Meta Ads ad set with CONVERSIONS optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize conversions - shows ads to people likely to complete a conversion action.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_SALES

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_SALES campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to CONVERSIONS
- Note: May require promoted_object with pixel_id and custom_event_type (not yet implemented)

Create a Meta Ads ad set with LEAD_GENERATION optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize lead generation - shows ads to people likely to submit lead forms.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_LEADS

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_LEADS campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to LEAD_GENERATION

Create a Meta Ads ad set with APP_INSTALLS optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize app installs - shows ads to people likely to install your app.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to APP_INSTALLS
- Note: May require promoted_object with application_id (not yet implemented)

Create a Meta Ads ad set with POST_ENGAGEMENT optimization goal.

**Performance Goal:** Maximize post engagement - shows ads to people likely to engage with your posts.

**Compatible Campaign Objectives:**
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT

**Requirements:**
- campaign_id must belong to an OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT campaign
- optimization_goal is automatically set to POST_ENGAGEMENT

Create a single image ad for Meta Ads.

**Ad Set Selection:**
ad_set_id is REQUIRED. You must create an ad set first using POST /ad-sets/create
or select from existing ad sets.

**Image Requirements:**
- Either image_url or image_file must be provided
- Image must meet Facebook's ad image requirements
- Recommended size: 1200x628 pixels

Upload a video to Facebook Ad Account.

**Video Upload:**
- Either video_file (upload) OR video_url (public URL) must be provided
- Returns video_id which can be used when creating video ads
- Use the returned video_id in POST /ads/create/video endpoint

**Example:**
```bash
curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/api/v1/ads/video/upload" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -F "video_file=@/path/to/video.mp4"
```

Create a video ad for Meta Ads (JSON body, matches image ads pattern).

**Ad Set Selection:**
ad_set_id is REQUIRED. You must create an ad set first using POST /ad-sets/create
or select from existing ad sets.

**Video Requirements:**
- video_id is REQUIRED (upload video first using POST /ads/video/upload)
- Video thumbnail will be automatically extracted from the video if available
- Or provide thumbnail_image_url or thumbnail_image_hash

**Workflow:**
1. Upload video: POST /ads/video/upload â†’ get video_id
2. Create ad: POST /ads/create/video (this endpoint) with video_id

Create a video ad for Meta Ads.

**Ad Set Selection:**
ad_set_id is REQUIRED. You must create an ad set first using POST /ad-sets/create
or select from existing ad sets.

**Video Requirements:**
- Either video_file (upload) OR video_id (existing) must be provided
- If video_file is provided, it will be uploaded to Facebook first
- Video thumbnail will be automatically extracted from the video if available

Create a carousel ad for Meta Ads.

**Ad Set Selection:**
ad_set_id is REQUIRED. You must create an ad set first using POST /ad-sets/create
or select from existing ad sets.

**Carousel Requirements:**
- Must have between 2 and 10 cards
- Each card requires: image_url, headline, description, and link_url
- All cards should have consistent styling for best results

Create a collection ad for Meta Ads.

**Ad Set Selection:**
ad_set_id is REQUIRED. You must create an ad set first using POST /ad-sets/create
or select from existing ad sets.

**Collection Requirements:**
- Must have between 1 and 50 products
- Requires a hero_image_url for the main image
- Each product requires: name, image_url, description, and link_url
- Collection ads are great for showcasing multiple products

AllInOnePostRequest.title: AllInOnePostRequest
AllInOnePostRequest.description:
Unified request model for posting to multiple platforms simultaneously.

**Common Fields:**
- `media_id`: Single media ID from unified_media table (optional for text-only posts)
- `media_ids`: Multiple media IDs for carousel posts (optional)
- `platforms`: List of platforms to post to ["instagram", "twitter", "linkedin", "facebook", "tiktok", "youtube"]
- `text`: Universal text field (mapped to caption/title/text per platform)
- `post_type`: Global post type (optional, defaults to "post") - "post", "story", "reel", "draft", "carousel"
- `scheduled_time`: ISO format datetime string for scheduling posts

**Platform-Specific Parameters:**

**Instagram (`instagram_params`):**
- `post_type` (str, optional): "post" | "story" | "reel" | "carousel" (default: "post")
- `location_id` (str, optional): Instagram location ID for geotagging
- `container_id` (str, optional): Instagram container ID (for video posts)
- `caption` (str, optional): Override the global `text` field with Instagram-specific caption
- `thumbnail_timestamp` (float, optional): Timestamp in seconds for video story thumbnail (default: 5.0)
- `share_to_feed` (bool, optional): For reels, whether to share to feed (default: true)

**LinkedIn (`linkedin_params`):**
- `post_type` (str, optional): "post" | "video" | "carousel" (default: "post")
- `visibility` (str, optional): "PUBLIC" | "CONNECTIONS" (default: "PUBLIC")
- `text` (str, optional): Override the global `text` field with LinkedIn-specific text
- `title` (str, optional): Video title (for video posts only)
- `page_id` (str, optional): LinkedIn page ID (if posting to a page instead of personal profile)

**Twitter (`twitter_params`):**
- `text` (str, optional): Override the global `text` field with Twitter-specific tweet text
- Note: Twitter supports text-only tweets, single image, multiple images (max 4), and video tweets

**Facebook (`facebook_params`):**
- `post_type` (str, optional): "post" | "story" | "carousel" (default: "post")
- `page_id` (str, optional): Facebook page ID - **Auto-retrieved from user's managed pages if not provided**
- `message` (str, optional): Override the global `text` field with Facebook-specific message
- `privacy` (str, optional): Post privacy setting (default: "EVERYONE")
- Note: Facebook supports text-only posts (no media_id required). Just provide `text` without `media_id`.

**TikTok (`tiktok_params`):**
- `post_type` (str, optional): "video" | "photo" | "draft" (default: "video" for video media, "photo" for image media)
- `draft` (bool, optional): Alternative to `post_type="draft"` - creates a draft post instead of publishing
- `title` (str, optional): Video/photo title (overrides global `text` field)
- `description` (str, optional): Video/photo description
- `privacy_level` (str, optional): "PUBLIC_TO_EVERYONE" | "SELF_ONLY" | "FRIENDS" | etc. (default: "PUBLIC_TO_EVERYONE" for photos, "SELF_ONLY" for videos)
- `disable_comment` (bool, optional): Disable comments on the post (default: false)
- `auto_add_music` (bool, optional): Automatically add music to photos (default: false)
- `brand_content_toggle` (bool, optional): Paid partnership content (default: false)
- `brand_organic_toggle` (bool, optional): Creator's own business content (default: false)
- `cover_index` (int, optional): Index of photo to use as cover for photo posts (0-based, default: 0)
- `video_cover_timestamp_ms` (int, optional): Timestamp in milliseconds for video cover thumbnail (default: 1000)
- `disable_duet` (bool, optional): Disable duet feature for videos (default: false)
- `disable_stitch` (bool, optional): Disable stitch feature for videos (default: false)

**YouTube (`youtube_params`):**
- `title` (str, optional): Video title (overrides global `text` field, max 100 characters)
- `description` (str, optional): Video description (max 5000 characters)
- `tags` (str or list, optional): Comma-separated tags or list of tags (max 500 characters total)
- `privacy` (str, optional): "private" | "unlisted" | "public" (default: "private")
- `category_id` (str, optional): YouTube category ID (default: "22" for People & Blogs)
- `thumbnail_url` (str, optional): Custom thumbnail URL
- Note: YouTube only supports video posts (media_type must be "video")

optimization_goal.description:
Optimization goal (optional - select from dropdown or leave empty).

**Auto-Inference (Recommended):**
If you leave this empty, the system will automatically select the appropriate optimization goal based on your campaign's objective:
- OUTCOME_LEADS â†’ LEAD_GENERATION
- OUTCOME_SALES â†’ CONVERSIONS
- OUTCOME_TRAFFIC â†’ LINK_CLICKS
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT â†’ POST_ENGAGEMENT
- OUTCOME_APP_PROMOTION â†’ APP_INSTALLS
- OUTCOME_AWARENESS â†’ BRAND_AWARENESS

**Manual Selection:**
You can select from the dropdown, but only goals compatible with your campaign objective will be accepted. Invalid selections will be rejected with an error.

**Tip:** To see valid options for your campaign, use: GET /campaigns/{campaign_id}/optimization-goals

destination_type.description:
Destination type for ODAX (Outcome-Driven Ads Experiences) campaigns.

**Required for:**
- OUTCOME_LEADS â†’ ON_AD
- OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT â†’ ON_POST, ON_VIDEO, ON_EVENT, ON_PAGE

**Available values:**
- ON_AD: For lead generation campaigns (OUTCOME_LEADS)
- ON_PAGE: For page-related destinations (OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT)
- ON_POST: For post-related destinations (OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT)
- ON_VIDEO: For video-related destinations (OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT)
- ON_EVENT: For event-related destinations (OUTCOME_ENGAGEMENT)

**Note:** This parameter is required for ODAX campaigns according to Facebook API documentation. The destination_type must match your campaign objective.

promoted_object.description:
Promoted object for optimization goal-specific targeting.

**Required for:**
- CONVERSIONS optimization: requires pixel_id and custom_event_type
- APP_INSTALLS optimization: requires application_id
- PAGE_LIKES optimization: requires page_id

**Optional for:**
- LEAD_GENERATION: may include page_id and form_id
- POST_ENGAGEMENT: may include page_id and post_id

**Note:** If not provided, the system will attempt to use default values where available.
